Class CurrencyAmountAssert

java.lang.Object
org.fest.assertions.Assert
org.fest.assertions.GenericAssert<CurrencyAmount>
com.guidewire.testharness.assertion.BaseAssert<CurrencyAmount,CurrencyAmountAssert>
gw.fest.CurrencyAmountAssert
public class CurrencyAmountAssert extends com.guidewire.testharness.assertion.BaseAssert<CurrencyAmount,CurrencyAmountAssert>
Custom assertions for currency amount

  • Constructor Details

    • CurrencyAmountAssert

      public CurrencyAmountAssert(CurrencyAmount actual)
      Create a new CurrencyAmountAssert on the given currency amount
      Parameters:
      actual - the possibly null currency amount

  • Method Details

    • isEqualToIgnoringScale

      public CurrencyAmountAssert isEqualToIgnoringScale(CurrencyAmount expected)
      Checks if the currency amount is equal to the expected CurrencyAmount, ignoring the scale on the BigDecimal amount.

    • hasCurrency

      public CurrencyAmountAssert hasCurrency(Currency currency)
      Checks if the currency amount has the given currency
      Parameters:
      currency - the expected currency, or null if the amount has no currency
      Returns:
      this assertion

    • hasAmount

      public CurrencyAmountAssert hasAmount(BigDecimal amount)
      Checks if the currency amount has the expected amount value, using comparison by value. This means that if the actual amount is 0.00 and the provided amount is 0 this check will still succeed
      Parameters:
      amount - the expected amount, must not be null (currency amounts cannot have a null amount)
      Returns:
      this assertion

    • hasDifferentAmount

      public CurrencyAmountAssert hasDifferentAmount(BigDecimal amount)
      Checks if the currency amount has an amount value other than the one specified, using comparison by value. This means that if the actual amount is 3.00 and the provided amount is 3.0 this check will fail because 3.00 and 3.0 have the same value even though their scale is different
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount that should not be present, must not be null (currency amounts cannot have a null amount)
      Returns:
      this assertion

    • hasIntAmount

      public CurrencyAmountAssert hasIntAmount(int amount)
      Checks if the currency amount has the expected integer amount value, using comparison by value. This operation is only useful if the amount is an exact number of currency units (for example 1 Dollar or 3 Euros)
      Parameters:
      amount - the expected amount, must not be null
      Returns:
      this assertion

    • isZero

      public CurrencyAmountAssert isZero()
      Checks if the currency amount's amount value is zero
      Returns:
      this assertion

    • isNonZero

      public CurrencyAmountAssert isNonZero()
      Checks if the currency amount's amount value is non zero
      Returns:
      this assertion

    • hasExactAmount

      public CurrencyAmountAssert hasExactAmount(BigDecimal amount)
      Checks if the currency amount has the exact expected amount value, using the BigDecimal equals operator. This means that if the actual amount is 0.00 then the provided amount must also be 0.00 (not just 0 or 0.0) before this check will succeed.
      Parameters:
      amount - the expected amount, must not be null
      Returns:
      this assertion

    • hasDifferentExactAmount

      public CurrencyAmountAssert hasDifferentExactAmount(BigDecimal amount)
      Checks if the currency amount has an exact amount value other than the one specified. This means that if the actual amount is 0.00 and the provided amount is just 0 then this check will succeed because 0.00 has a different scale from 0.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount that should not be present, must not be null
      Returns:
      this assertion
